org.jerkar.api.java
Class JkClassLoader

java.lang.Object
  org.jerkar.api.java.JkClassLoader

public final class JkClassLoader
extends java.lang.Object

Wrapper around URLClassLoader offering convenient methods and fluent interface to deal with URLClassLoader.

Field Summary

          A FileFilter accepting only .class files.

CLASS_FILE_FILTER

public static final java.io.FileFilter CLASS_FILE_FILTER
A FileFilter accepting only .class files.

Method Detail

urlCacheDir

public static void urlCacheDir(java.io.File dir)
Set the directory where are cached urls. For its internal use, Jerkar may copy the the content of an URL to a file. This class manages the central place where those URL are cached.

sibling

public JkClassLoader sibling(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object> urlOrFiles)
Creates a JkClassLoader loader having the same parent and the same entries as this one plus the specified entries. URL entries that are not file are transformed to file (created in temp folder).

sibling

sibling(Iterable)

siblingWithOptional

public JkClassLoader siblingWithOptional(java.lang.Object... fileOrUrls)
Same as sibling(Object...) but more tolerant about the input. If one of the specified entry is not valid, then it is simply ignored.

load

public <T> java.lang.Class<T> load(java.lang.String className)
Delegates the call to ClassLoader.loadClass(String) of this wrapped class loader.
The specified class is supposed to be defined in this class loader, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

See Also:
#isDefined(String)

loadGivenClassSourcePathIfExist

public <T> java.lang.Class<T> loadGivenClassSourcePathIfExist(java.lang.String classSourcePath)
Loads a class given its source relative path if exists. For example loadGivenSourcePath("mypack1/subpack/MyClass.java") will load the class mypack1.subpack.MyClass. Return null if no such class exist.

loadGivenClassSourcePath

public <T> java.lang.Class<T> loadGivenClassSourcePath(java.lang.String classSourcePath)
Loads a class given its source relative path. For example loadGivenSourcePath("mypack1/subpack/MyClass.java") will load the class mypack1.subpack.MyClass.

loadIfExist

public <T> java.lang.Class<T> loadIfExist(java.lang.String className)
Loads the class having the specified name or return null if no such class is defined in this class loader.

isDefined

public boolean isDefined(java.lang.String className)
Returns if the specified class is defined in this class loader.

loadFromNameOrSimpleName

public <T> java.lang.Class<? extends T> loadFromNameOrSimpleName(java.lang.String name,
                                                                 java.lang.Class<T> superClassArg)
Loads the class having the specified full name or the specified simple name. Returns null if no class matches.
For example : loadFromNameOrSimpleName("MyClass", null) may return the class my.pack.MyClass.

Parameters:
name - The full name or the simple name of the class to load
superClassArg - If not null, the search is narrowed to classes/interfaces children of this class/interface.
Returns:
The loaded class or null.

loadClassesInEntries

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Object>> loadClassesInEntries(java.io.FileFilter entryFilter)
Returns all classes of this classloader that are defined in entries matching the specified fileFilter.
For example : if you want to load all classes that are defined in folder and not in jar file, you have to provide a FileFilter which includes only directories.

Parameters:
entryFilter - The classpath entry filter. Can be null.

loadClasses

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<?>> loadClasses(JkPathFilter classFileFilter)
Loads all class having a relative path matching the supplied JkPathFilter. For example, if you want to load all class belonging to my.pack or its sub package, then you have to supply a filter with an include pattern as my/pack/**/*.class. Note that ending with .class is important.

loadClasses

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<?>> loadClasses(java.lang.String... includingPatterns)
Loads all class having a relative path matching the supplied ANT pattern. For example, if you want to load all class belonging to my.pack or its sub package, then you have to supply a the following pattern my/pack/**/*.

See Also:
loadClasses(JkPathFilter)

loadClassesIn

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Object>> loadClassesIn(JkFileTreeSet jkFileTreeSet)
Returns all classes of this classloader that are defined inside the provided JkFileTreeSet.

See Also:
loadClassesInEntries(FileFilter)

See Also:

findMainClass

public static java.lang.String findMainClass(java.io.File classDirOrJar)
Returns the first class having a main method from the specified class directory or Jar. Returns null if no such class found.

addEntry

public void addEntry(java.io.File entry)
Add a new entry to this class loader. WARN : This method has side effect on this class loader : use it with caution !

addEntries

public void addEntries(java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> entries)
Same as addEntry(File) but for several entries.

invokeStaticMethod

public <T> T invokeStaticMethod(boolean serializeResult,
                                java.lang.String className,
                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                java.lang.Object... args)
Invokes a static method on the specified class using the provided arguments.
If the argument classes are the same on the current class loader and this one then arguments are passed as is, otherwise arguments are serialized in the current class loader and deserialized in this class loader in order to be compliant with it.
The current thread context class loader is switched to this for the method execution.
It is then turned back to the former one when the execution is done.

invokeInstanceMethod

public <T> T invokeInstanceMethod(boolean serializeResult,
                                  java.lang.Object object,
                                  java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                  java.lang.Object... args)
Invokes an instance method on the specified object using the specified arguments.
If the argument classes are the same on the current class loader and this one then arguments are passed as is, otherwise arguments are serialized in the current class loader and deserialized in this class loader in order to be compliant with it.
The current thread context class loader is switched to this for the method execution.
It is then turned back to the former one when the execution is done.

newInstance

public <T> T newInstance(java.lang.String className)
Creates an instance of the class having the specified name in this class loader.

loadAllServices

public JkClassLoader loadAllServices()
Reloads all J2SE service providers. It can be necessary if adding dynamically some service providers to the classpath.

transClassloaderProxy

public <T> T transClassloaderProxy(java.lang.Class<T> interfaze,
                                   java.lang.String className,
                                   java.lang.String staticMethodFactory,
                                   java.lang.Object... args)
Creates an instance from the specified class in this classloader and callable from the current class loader. Arguments ans result are serialized (if needed) so we keep compatibility between classes.
